lexUnit.name: rise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of the sun, moon, or stars) appear above the horizon.

sentence.text: Each day the sun rose later and weaker and with it her strength too seemed to ebb .
She made some coffee , and went out on the balcony in her cotton housecoat , where she could see the sun rising from behind the dark hills , and the slopes slowly become bathed with light .
The sun was rising behind the rainclouds .
The mist changed to a warm pink and began to disperse as the sun rose above the horizon .
Slipping on his gloves , he saw out of the corner of his eye the sun rising above a belt of dark blue .
The pursuit began as the sun rose across the bay .
He ` proves " the bowl shape of the Earth by claiming that if it were flat , the sun would rise simultaneously in all places .
The sun rose magnificently over one of these slopes , warm hues glistening off the windswept , spiky blue ice .
As the sun was rising the next morning , Gabriel waited outside his hut until he saw the young woman riding up the hill .
The room is dazzling snow , the moon has risen full and cold .
We knew it never got submerged by the tide and our idea was to take some photographs of a full moon rising over Widemouth .
The moon had risen from behind the peach tree and its light came pouring in through the open windows .
Outside his window the moon had risen over the fells and it was reflected exactly in the round lake .
After a time a full yellow moon rose above the ridge of the eastern desert .
The moon had risen behind the house , making it look like a silhouetted stage-set ; servants came out of it in procession , bearing the next course .
